intro: Horkelia sabulosa, commonly known as sand heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, violet-blue flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes and dry slopes. It has hairy leaves and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Horkelia sabulosa is an important component of coastal plant communities and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
